column1: #Text=Polycrystalline samples of the series GdCo5ô€€€xNix were\rsynthesized by arc melting the constituent elements on a\rwater cooled copper hearth under an argon atmosphere.
#Text=The starting elements (99% purity) were taken in the stoichiometric\rratios with 1% excess of Gd to compensate for\rlosses during melting.
#Text=To ensure homogeneity, the ingots\rwere \ripped and remelted at least three times.
#Text=Annealing\rfor 10 days at 950 \C was tried to improve phase homogeneity,\ras discussed by Buschow and den Broeder [23].

#Text=However, analysis of the annealed samples (via the same\rmethods described below) showed no convincing evidence\rthat annealing promotes the 1:5 [Gd:(Co, Ni)] phase formation\rover the neighboring phases of 2:17 and 2:7, and\rso as-cast samples were used (provided they were found\rto be su\ciently phase pure, as described in the remainder\rof this section).
